name: had not
description:
This is 'had not', a new video game from Outhouse Media.
The game is 'Eye of the Tiger' and developed by 'Wind Edge'. It's a surreal, jaw-dropping, and utterly moving experience that offers absolutely no perspective whatsoever. The game was made by Outhouse Media and is available to download on PC, Mac, Linux and iOS. It's certainly different from the usual games out there, which are polished and aim to give players experience in different ways. This isn't a static game, it's a unique experience to the old school tradition. It doesn't make sense to describe this as an 'epic' game, it's something that's pretty difficult to describe. I have no problem with a game that offers a level of freedom, but I have a big problem when a game pretends to be so powerful that it can put the player in a trance of wonder. Instead of putting the player into an environment that can only exist in the mind of the player, Outhouse Media try to force the player to constantly expect something from the game. The game is simple, not hard to pick up to play, and the experience in it is fantastic. It has that bombarded feeling that I always get after playing a demo that has been heavily polished. Does this mean that the developer failed? It's possible. But, what it really tells me is that Outhouse Media are wise enough to not develop
